div.a: Pre-Registration for 2020/2021 for 'new-to-district' students

span.p: Due to the current circumstances and precautions regarding COVID-19, in-person preregistration for the 2020/2021 school year has been postponed. However, those new to the district are encouraged to download the appropriate Pre-Registration packet, complete it, and submit electronically or fax to the school. Please contact the school with any questions.
Panther Academy (for Kindergarten students) - Pre-Registration packet
Helmwood Heights Elementary School (grades 1 - 5) - PreRegistration Packet
T K Stone Middle School (grades 6 - 8) - PreRegistration packet

div.a: Noon Rotary Students of the Month-February

img.alt: February Students of the Month for Noon Rotary

span.p: Kaitlyn Brandenburg and Myles Fields were recognized as Noon Rotary students of the month for February.

div.a: 2019-2020 ExCEL Winner, Mrs. Michele Deon

img.alt: Michele Deon with Cheryl Williams from LG&E and KU

span.p: Michele Deon was honored and awarded the WHAS11/LG&E-KU 2019-2020 ExCEL Award on February 19, 2020. Several dignitaries applauded her dedication and commitment to all students and her belief in their futures beyond EHS. She and her husband selflessly donated $250 to each of the other nominated ExCEL teachers so they too can purchase instructional materials for their classrooms. WHAS11/LG&E-KU donated $1000.00 to Mrs. Deon for her classroom needs. Congratulations Mrs. Deon for earning the title, ExCEL Teacher of the Year, 2019-2020.

div.a: February Students of the Month

span.p: Congratulations to the Students of the Month from all of our schools. Pictured are Demi Cleaver from Helmwood Heights, Josie Kremzar from Elizabethtown High, Weston Yates from Panther Academy, Zoha Ahmed from TK Stone, and Meredith Dyer from Morningside. Not pictured, but still complimented on the award is Alexandra Allison representing Panther Place.

div.a: Perfect Score on Microsoft Excel Certification Exam

span.p: Elizabethtown High School would like to congratulate sophomore Emily Pike for earning a perfect score (1,000 points) on the Microsoft Office Excel certification exam! Congratulations to Emily Pike on accomplishing such a challenging task!

div.a: View All News

div.class: col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-4 col-lg-4 home-right home-right-top

h4.span: Tradition... Pride... Excellence... Accountability... Commitment... Student-Centered

span.p: We are committed to high expectations for our students and with the support of parents/guardians and the community and the dedication of the students and staff, we will continue the tradition of excellence of the Elizabethtown Independent Schools and move our students forward!

span.strong: Non-Traditional Instruction will continue until May 1, 2020

span.p:
Elizabethtown Independent Schools will be closed for in-person instruction. Staff will be working from home to provide instruction and support for our families and students. We are using technology more than ever. Several schools had been using Google Classroom before NTI days began and our students are familiar with this type of instruction. We understand and appreciate the added assistance needed by parents and guardians during NTI. We have always believed that education is a partnership with our families and community. We are all in this together.
Once we resume services on April 6, food service will be during the lunchtime only (no breakfast times). Breakfast will be included for the next day with those lunches. Please remember this is for any child 18 or under and they must be present to receive the food. A listing of times and sites can be found on the Elizabethtown Independent Schools’ homepage.

span.strong: Don't forget to follow the guidelines given by our Governor.

strong.span: Please click this link to view the Non-Discrimination Policy Statement.

div.class: hidden-xs col-sm-4 col-md-4 col-lg-4 home-right home-right-top

div.p: The EIS District is rated Distinguished (and Progressing) and ranked in the top ninth percentile of all Kentucky school districts on the 2014 KY Assessment.
Elizabethtown High School is also rated Distinguished and outscored 90% of all Kentucky high schools on the 2014 KY Assessment.
Especially significant are the Elizabethtown High School Social Studies scores which are ranked third out of over 200 high schools in the state!
T K Stone Middle School and Morningside Elementary School are rated Proficient, and Helmwood Heights Elementary School missed the Proficiency category by two percentage points.
EIS is honored with SCHOOL MATCH AWARD: What Parents Want
